pageTitle: London Bridge bus station closed for emergency Thames Water repair works

title.title: London Bridge bus station closed for emergency Thames Water repair works

texts: London Bridge bus station has been closed to allow Thames Water to make emergency repairs to a collapsed sewer that was discovered on London Bridge Street over the weekend.
The bus station is now closed and due to reopen on Monday 24 December.Â  During these emergency works London buses will call at nearby stops on London Bridge instead.
Bus routes affected are numbers 43, 48, 141, 149, 521, N21 and N343.
Revised stopping arrangements will be clearly displayed on posters around the bus station, in local bus stops and on the TfL website tfl.gov.uk/livetravelnews .
Passengers are advised to allow extra time to complete their journeys.
Taxis will also be unable to serve the rank at London Bridge bus station.
This unavoidable closure is necessary to ensure Thames Water can continuously work on these essential repairs to enable the bus station to reopen and resume a normal service as quickly as possible.
